definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Once again, the cornerstone is community.
sentences.chinese: 的確，社區是這一切的基石。

sentences.english: The new system came to define much about American life.
sentences.chinese: 這種新制度逐漸奠定了美國生活方式的基石。

sentences.english: Family is the bedrock of Chinese society, at least in theory.
sentences.chinese: 家庭是中國社會的基石，至少在理論上如此。

sentences.english: Neutralism is the cornerstone of neutralism foreign policy.
sentences.chinese: 中立主義是緬甸外交政策的基石。

sentences.english: Evolutionary literary viewpoint is the cornerstone of the literary revolution.
sentences.chinese: 進化論文學觀是文學革命的理論基石。

sentences.english: Chuang-tzu's theory of man's nature, simplisy, is the base of his theory of cultivating virtues.
sentences.chinese: 莊子的人性素樸論是其德行修養觀的基石。

sentences.english: It is thought to be a cornerstone of free speech on the Web.
sentences.chinese: 這被視爲是網絡言論自由的奠基石。

sentences.english: The sunlit pedestal drops three more stories to the cave floor.
sentences.chinese: 這一塊陽光照射的基石離洞底足足三層樓高。

sentences.english: But it might be a ground-up launching pad for the newspapers of tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 但是，它會是未來報業的奠基石。

sentences.english: The US-Japan alliance, he said, would "continue to be the cornerstone of Japanese diplomatic policy".
sentences.chinese: 他說，“日美聯盟將繼續是日本外交政策的基石”。

sentences.english: For her, Braille is a cornerstone of education.
sentences.chinese: 對她來說，盲文是教育的基石。

sentences.english: The EMH and the disputation about it form the foundation of all kinds of investment strategy.
sentences.chinese: 有效市場理論及其爭論是一切投資策略理論的基石。

sentences.english: Self-confidence is one of the cornerstones of success.
sentences.chinese: 自信是成功的奠基石之一。

sentences.english: According to the inscription on its cornerstone, this building was erected in 1919。
sentences.chinese: 根據基石上的碑銘，這棟建築物建於1919年。

sentences.english: The foundation stone of modern evidence law is composed of the principles of evidentiary adjudication and discretional evaluation of evidence.
sentences.chinese: 證據裁判與自由心證兩大原則構成現代證據法的基石。

sentences.english: We must find this headstone praised by Templars.
sentences.chinese: 我們得找到這塊被聖殿騎士讚揚過的基石。

definition: of the utmost importance/of highest priority
